00005 #ifndef SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
00006 #define SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
00007 
00008 #include <map>
00009 #include <string>
00010 #include <nacl/nacl_npapi.h>
00011 
00012 namespace bridge {
00013   class ScriptingBridge : public NPObject {
00014    public:
00015     typedef bool (ScriptingBridge::*Method)(const NPVariant* args,
00016                                             uint32_t arg_count,
00017                                             NPVariant* result);
00018 
00019     typedef bool (ScriptingBridge::*Property)( NPVariant* result);
00020     
00021     explicit ScriptingBridge(NPP npp) : npp_(npp){};
00022     virtual ~ScriptingBridge();
00023 
00024     // These methods represent the NPObject implementation.  The browser calls
00025     // these methods by calling functions in the |np_class| struct.
00026     virtual void Invalidate();
00027     bool AddMethod(std::string, Method, NPIdentifier);
00028     
00029     virtual bool HasMethod(NPIdentifier name);
00030     virtual bool Invoke(NPIdentifier name,
00031                         const NPVariant* args,
00032                         uint32_t arg_count,
00033                         NPVariant* result);
00034     virtual bool InvokeDefault(const NPVariant* args,
00035                                uint32_t arg_count,
00036                                NPVariant* result);
00037     virtual bool HasProperty(NPIdentifier name);
00038     virtual bool GetProperty(NPIdentifier name, NPVariant* result);
00039     virtual bool SetProperty(NPIdentifier name, const NPVariant* value);
00040     virtual bool RemoveProperty(NPIdentifier name);
00041 
00042     // static bool InitializeIdentifiers();
00043     bool InitializeIdentifiers();
00044 
00045     static NPClass np_class;
00046 
00047     // These methods are exposed via the scripting bridge to the browser.
00048     // Each one is mapped to a string id, which is the name of the method that
00049     // the broswer sees.  For example, Paint() has id 'paint', so in the browser
00050     // JavaScript, you would write tumbler.paint() to invoke the Paint() method
00051     // in this object.
00052     //
00053     // Each of these methods wraps a method in the associated Pepper3D object,
00054     // which is where the actual implementation lies.
00055 
00056     // Draws the quarter-circle image representing the stochasitc PI generator.
00057     bool Paint(const NPVariant* args, uint32_t arg_count, NPVariant* result);
00058 
00059    protected:
00060     NPP npp_;
00061     NPObject* window_object_;
00062     //NPWindow* window_object_;    
00063 
00064     static NPIdentifier id_paint;
00065     static std::map<NPIdentifier, Method>* method_table;
00066     static std::map<NPIdentifier, Property>* property_table;
00067   };
00068 
00069 }  // namespace bridge
00070 
00071 #endif  // EXAMPLES_PI_GENERATOR_SCRIPTING_BRIDGE_H_
